title: National Domestic Violence Hotline
description: 24/7 confidential support for domestic violence survivors and those who care about them. Provides crisis intervention, safety planning, and referrals to local resources.

title: National Coalition Against Domestic Violence (NCADV)
description: Leading national organization working to end domestic violence through education, advocacy, and policy reform. Provides comprehensive statistics and educational materials.

title: RAINN - National Sexual Assault Hotline
description: Provides support for sexual assault survivors, which often overlaps with domestic violence. 24/7 confidential support and local referrals.

title: Family Violence Prevention Services Program
description: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services program that funds domestic violence services nationwide. Provides directory of local services.

title: National Center on Domestic Violence
description: Provides training, technical assistance, and resources to domestic violence programs and advocates nationwide.

title: WomensLaw.org
description: Provides legal information and resources for domestic violence survivors, including restraining orders, custody issues, and safety planning.

title: YWCA USA
description: Operates domestic violence shelters and support programs across the United States. Provides emergency housing, counseling, and advocacy.

title: Love Is Respect
description: National resource for teens and young adults experiencing dating abuse. Provides 24/7 support via phone, text, and chat.

title: Crisis Text Line
description: Free, 24/7 crisis support via text message. Trained counselors provide support for domestic violence situations.

title: National Resource Center on Domestic Violence
description: Provides comprehensive resources, training materials, and research on domestic violence prevention and intervention.

title: Bureau of Justice Statistics - Domestic Violence
description: Official U.S. government statistics on domestic violence incidents, trends, and criminal justice responses.

title: Safe Horizon
description: Largest victim services organization in the U.S. Provides shelter, counseling, and advocacy for domestic violence survivors.

title: Office for Victims of Crime
description: U.S. Department of Justice office that provides funding and resources for victim services, including domestic violence programs.

title: National Indigenous Women's Resource Center
description: Provides culturally appropriate resources and support for Native American women experiencing domestic violence.

title: Asian Pacific Institute on Gender-Based Violence
description: Provides culturally specific resources and advocacy for Asian and Pacific Islander communities affected by domestic violence.

title: Corporate Alliance to End Partner Violence
description: Provides resources for employers and employees on addressing domestic violence in the workplace.

title: Futures Without Violence
description: National organization focused on preventing and ending domestic violence through policy advocacy and education.

title: National Network to End Domestic Violence
description: Leading voice for domestic violence victims and survivors, providing policy advocacy and public awareness.
